title: How to Make Rainbow Frosting

steps.headline: Beat the butter in a large bowl using an electric mixer.
steps.description: Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 2-3 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour in the powdered sugar.
steps.description: Slowly blend in the powdered sugar on low speed. Blend until the frosting becomes stiff, taking about 2-4 minutes.

steps.headline: Add in the whipping cream and vanilla extract.
steps.description: Blend once more on high speed for about 5 minutes until fully combined.

steps.headline: Separate the frosting into three medium-sized bowls.
Add a teaspoon of food coloring into each frosting.
steps.description: Mix well using a spoon until the frosting color shows and is vibrant. Use a clean spoon every time you mix a new frosting color to avoid a grayish color into the frosting from mixing multiple colors.

steps.headline: Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag.
steps.description: Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Close the bag and place any desired piping tip onto it.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness!

steps.headline: Beat the butter and cream cheese in a large bowl using an electric mixer.
steps.description: Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 2-3 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour in the powdered sugar.
steps.description: Slowly blend in the powdered sugar on low speed. Blend until the frosting becomes stiff, taking about 2-4 minutes.

steps.headline: Add in the vanilla extract and milk.
steps.description: Blend once more on high speed for about 5 minutes until fully combined and creamy.

steps.headline: Separate the frosting into medium-sized bowls.
steps.description: The amount of bowls depends on how many colors you are creating for the frosting.

steps.headline: Add a teaspoon of food coloring into each frosting.
steps.description: Mix well using a spoon until the frosting color shows and is vibrant. Use a clean spoon every time you mix a new frosting color to avoid a grayish color into the frosting from mixing multiple colors.

steps.headline: Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag.
steps.description: Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Close the bag and place any desired piping tip onto it.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness!

steps.headline: Beat the butter in a large bowl using an electric mixer.
steps.description: Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 2-3 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour in the powdered sugar.
steps.description: Slowly blend in the powdered sugar on low speed. Blend until the frosting becomes stiff, taking about 2-4 minutes.

steps.headline: Add in the vanilla extract and milk.
steps.description: Blend once more on high speed for about 5 minutes until fully combined and creamy.

steps.headline: Separate the frosting into medium-sized bowls.
steps.description: The amount of bowls depends on how many colors you are creating for the frosting.

steps.headline: Add a teaspoon of food coloring into each frosting.
steps.description: Mix well using a spoon until the frosting color shows and is vibrant. Use a clean spoon every time you mix a new frosting color to avoid a grayish color into the frosting from mixing multiple colors.

steps.headline: Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag.
steps.description: Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the edible glitter or disco dust all over the frosting.
steps.description: Close the pastry bag and place any desired piping tip onto it.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness!

steps.headline: Separate the Skittles into each color.
steps.description: Separate the five different groups of colored Skittles and place them into medium-sized microwave safe bowls. You should have one group with green, one with yellow, one with red, one with brown, and another one with orange.

steps.headline: Microwave the Skittles.
steps.description: Microwave each group of Skittles for about 30 seconds, stirring in a tablespoon of milk, and then microwaving again for an additional 30 minutes. Repeat with the rest of the colors.

steps.headline: Allow the melted Skittles to cool for about 5 minutes.
Beat the butter in a large bowl using an electric mixer.
steps.description: Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 2-3 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour in the powdered sugar and tablespoon of milk.
steps.description: Slowly blend in the frosting on low speed. Blend until the frosting becomes stiff, taking about 2-4 minutes.

steps.headline: Separate the frosting into 5 medium-sized bowls.
Pour one color of the melted Skittles into each bowl and stir well.
steps.description: Mix until the color is bright and the frosting is fully combined.

steps.headline: Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag.
steps.description: Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Close the bag and place any desired piping tip onto it.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness!

steps.headline: Beat the butter and shortening in a large bowl using an electric mixer.
steps.description: Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 3-5 minutes.

steps.headline: Add in the vanilla extract, almond extract, and milk.
steps.description: Blend once more on high speed for about 5 minutes until fully combined and creamy.

steps.headline: Separate the frosting into 4 medium-sized bowls.
Add a tablespoon of a colored juice into each bowl of frosting.
steps.description: Mix well using a spoon until the frosting color shows and is vibrant. Use a clean spoon every time you mix a new frosting color to avoid a grayish color into the frosting from mixing multiple colors.

steps.headline: Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag.
steps.description: Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Close the bag and place any desired piping tip onto it.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness!

steps.headline: Beat the butter and marshmallow creme in a large bowl using an electric mixer.
steps.description: Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 2-3 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour in the powdered sugar.
steps.description: Slowly blend in the powdered sugar on low speed. Blend until the frosting becomes stiff, taking about 2-4 minutes.

steps.headline: Add in the salt and vanilla extract.
steps.description: Blend once more on high speed for about 5 minutes until fully combined.

steps.headline: Separate the frosting into medium-sized bowls.
steps.description: The amount of bowls depends on how many colors you are creating for the frosting.

steps.headline: Add a teaspoon of food coloring into each frosting.
steps.description: Mix well using a spoon until the frosting color shows and is vibrant. Use a clean spoon every time you mix a new frosting color to avoid a grayish color into the frosting from mixing multiple colors.

steps.headline: Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag.
steps.description: Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Close the bag and place any desired piping tip onto it.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness!

text: Buttercream Rainbow Frosting Beat the butter in a large bowl using an electric mixer. Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 2-3 minutes. Pour in the powdered sugar. Slowly blend in the powdered sugar on low speed. Blend until the frosting becomes stiff, taking about 2-4 minutes. Add in the whipping cream and vanilla extract. Blend once more on high speed for about 5 minutes until fully combined. Separate the frosting into three medium-sized bowls.  Add a teaspoon of food coloring into each frosting. Mix well using a spoon until the frosting color shows and is vibrant. Use a clean spoon every time you mix a new frosting color to avoid a grayish color into the frosting from mixing multiple colors. Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag. Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Close the bag and place any desired piping tip onto it. Serve. Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness! Cream Cheese Rainbow Frosting Beat the butter and cream cheese in a large bowl using an electric mixer. Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 2-3 minutes. Pour in the powdered sugar. Slowly blend in the powdered sugar on low speed. Blend until the frosting becomes stiff, taking about 2-4 minutes. Add in the vanilla extract and milk. Blend once more on high speed for about 5 minutes until fully combined and creamy. Separate the frosting into medium-sized bowls. The amount of bowls depends on how many colors you are creating for the frosting. Add a teaspoon of food coloring into each frosting. Mix well using a spoon until the frosting color shows and is vibrant. Use a clean spoon every time you mix a new frosting color to avoid a grayish color into the frosting from mixing multiple colors. Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag. Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Close the bag and place any desired piping tip onto it. Serve. Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness! Sparkly Rainbow Frosting Beat the butter in a large bowl using an electric mixer. Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 2-3 minutes. Pour in the powdered sugar. Slowly blend in the powdered sugar on low speed. Blend until the frosting becomes stiff, taking about 2-4 minutes. Add in the vanilla extract and milk. Blend once more on high speed for about 5 minutes until fully combined and creamy. Separate the frosting into medium-sized bowls. The amount of bowls depends on how many colors you are creating for the frosting. Add a teaspoon of food coloring into each frosting. Mix well using a spoon until the frosting color shows and is vibrant. Use a clean spoon every time you mix a new frosting color to avoid a grayish color into the frosting from mixing multiple colors. Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag. Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Sprinkle the edible glitter or disco dust all over the frosting. Close the pastry bag and place any desired piping tip onto it. Serve. Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness! Skittles Rainbow Frosting Separate the Skittles into each color. Separate the five different groups of colored Skittles and place them into medium-sized microwave safe bowls. You should have one group with green, one with yellow, one with red, one with brown, and another one with orange. Microwave the Skittles. Microwave each group of Skittles for about 30 seconds, stirring in a tablespoon of milk, and then microwaving again for an additional 30 minutes. Repeat with the rest of the colors. Allow the melted Skittles to cool for about 5 minutes.  Beat the butter in a large bowl using an electric mixer. Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 2-3 minutes. Pour in the powdered sugar and tablespoon of milk. Slowly blend in the frosting on low speed. Blend until the frosting becomes stiff, taking about 2-4 minutes. Separate the frosting into 5 medium-sized bowls.  Pour one color of the melted Skittles into each bowl and stir well. Mix until the color is bright and the frosting is fully combined. Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag. Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Close the bag and place any desired piping tip onto it. Serve. Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness! Natural Rainbow Frosting Beat the butter and shortening in a large bowl using an electric mixer. Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 3-5 minutes. Add in the vanilla extract, almond extract, and milk. Blend once more on high speed for about 5 minutes until fully combined and creamy. Separate the frosting into 4 medium-sized bowls.  Add a tablespoon of a colored juice into each bowl of frosting. Mix well using a spoon until the frosting color shows and is vibrant. Use a clean spoon every time you mix a new frosting color to avoid a grayish color into the frosting from mixing multiple colors. Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag. Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Close the bag and place any desired piping tip onto it. Serve. Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness! Marshmallow Rainbow Frosting Beat the butter and marshmallow creme in a large bowl using an electric mixer. Blend and cream well on a medium setting, mixing until the butter is fully whipped, taking about 2-3 minutes. Pour in the powdered sugar. Slowly blend in the powdered sugar on low speed. Blend until the frosting becomes stiff, taking about 2-4 minutes. Add in the salt and vanilla extract. Blend once more on high speed for about 5 minutes until fully combined. Separate the frosting into medium-sized bowls. The amount of bowls depends on how many colors you are creating for the frosting. Add a teaspoon of food coloring into each frosting. Mix well using a spoon until the frosting color shows and is vibrant. Use a clean spoon every time you mix a new frosting color to avoid a grayish color into the frosting from mixing multiple colors. Spoon the frosting colors onto a piping bag. Using a spoon, spread equal amounts of frosting all over the piping bag. Close the bag and place any desired piping tip onto it. Serve. Using the piping bag, swirl over the rainbow frosting on any other desired dessert. Enjoy the colorful goodness!
